thread.title: U.S. Bank Sues Countrywide for $178M in RMBS Losses
thread.title_full: U.S. Bank Sues Countrywide for $178M in RMBS Losses

author: Orrick - Structured Finance Group
title: U.S. Bank Sues Countrywide for $178M in RMBS Losses
text:
less- <iframe src="http://www.jdsupra.com/post/contentViewerEmbed.aspx?fid=7a29e823-fc96-4eb3-bd93-a7af1af6d54a" width="100%" height="620" frameborder="1" style="border: 2px solid #ccc; overflow-x:hidden !important; overflow:hidden;" scrolling="auto"> 
CHL”), Countrywide Home Loans Servicing LP (“Countrywide Servicing”), and others, seeking to recover $178 million in losses over alleged breaches of representations and warranties made about the sold to the Trust. U.S. Bank alleges that, despite receiving repurchase demands in connection with allegedly breaching loans, CHL failed to cure or repurchase the loans, or indemnify the Trust for the resultant losses. U.S. Bank also claims that Countrywide Servicing failed to notify the Trustee when it discovered breaches, and failed to force CHL to repurchase or substitute such breaching loans. U.S. Bank seeks specific performance, declaratory relief, damages, indemnification, and prejudgment interest. Summons with Notice .
